text: [Music]
opening eyes mission is to develop
artificial intelligence technology and
make sure that it benefits as many
people as possible open e I has a bunch
of different research projects one of
the ones that was announced recently was
our robotics results they trained a
robotic hand that has 20 degrees of
freedom in simulation and were then able
to transfer the AI to a real robot where
it can manipulate a cube I want to open
a eyes other research projects is a
videogame project they're working on
metal learning which is learning to
learn and they have a collection of
different video games like Super
Nintendo games of learning to play Mario
or Sonic the Hedgehog and the goal is to
be able to learn many different games in
a very short amount of time similar to
how a human can transfer their
experience between the different games
open AI has a bunch of different
research projects one of them is dota 2
which is a video game developed by valve
it's one of the most popular games
that's played professionally and we had
a show match at the international
tournament that was held last month it
was very exciting to see it play against
two of the world's top teams and have a
very good showing we decided to go with
kubernetes because we really liked the
community and the rate at which it was
making progress it also was much easier
to operate than the other systems that
we tested the way that we use kubernetes
is a little bit different
I imagine than most other companies we
primarily use it as a batch scheduler
and for high-performance computing jobs
and that's because all of our research
and training is moving towards these
very large distributed systems for
training complex models one of the
scheduling features in kubernetes that
we use a lot is its ability to handle
GPUs and schedule them as part of pods
almost all of our pods use GPUs because
we run tensorflow which is a training
system for training deep learning models
and it requires GPUs to accelerate the
training we found kubernetes extremely
easy to run on scale
we've run for production clusters and
over 2,500 nodes with a team of just two
people and I'm pretty sure the last time
we were paged was over a month ago
there's almost no downtime in our
clusters at opening I were solving some
of the hardest research challenges and
most difficult infrastructure projects
we're building out new super computing
clusters and expect to continue scaling
our research and infrastructure
